TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GridViewRowCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GridViewRowCollection class is used to store and manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> objects in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control. Each row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control is represented by a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control stores all of its data rows in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows%2A> collection.
The GridViewRowCollection class supports several ways to access the items in the collection:
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.Item%2A> indexer to directly retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object at a specific zero-based index.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to retrieve an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the items in the collection into an <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, which can then be used to access the items in the collection.
To determine the total number of items in the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection.Count%2A> property
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to iterate through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.Rows%2A> collection of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control and display the values of a column on the page.
[!code-cs[GridViewRowCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_35_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[GridViewRowCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_35_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.ArrayList rows) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that contains the objects with which to initialize the collection.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> class using the specified <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList?displayProperty=fullName> object. The <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList?displayProperty=fullName> object should contain the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> objects with which to populate the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow[] array, int index);
.method public hidebysig instance void CopyTo(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow[] array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: A zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object that receives the copied items from the object.
The first index in the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object to receive the copied contents.
Docs.summary: Copies all the items from this to the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, starting at the specified index in the <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to copy the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object into the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, starting at the specified index. The <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object can then be used to access the items in the collection.
> [!NOTE] > You must use a zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object for the `array` parameter.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the CopyTo method to copy the items of collection into an array. The array is iterated through and the values of the first cell are displayed on the page.
[!code-vb[GridViewRowCollectionCopyTo#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/4296a84b-4a08-4e69-ae21-_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[GridViewRowCollectionCopyTo#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/4296a84b-4a08-4e69-ae21-_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets the number of items in the object.
Docs.value: The number of items in the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the Count property to determine the number of items in the collection. The Count property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound of the collection. The Count property is also commonly used to determine whether a collection is empty.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the Count property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control contains any records. A value greater than zero indicates that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control contains at least one record.
[!code-cs[GridViewRowCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_700_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[GridViewRowCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_700_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an enumerator that contains all objects in the .
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object that contains all objects in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to get an enumerator that can be iterated through linearly to access each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection>. To access the item at the current position in the enumerator, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move to the next item in the collection. To move the enumerator to its initial position, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
> [!NOTE] > When you initially get the enumerator or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method. Otherwise, the item that is represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is undefined.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the GetEnumerator method to retrieve an enumerator that contains the values from the collection. The enumerator is iterated through and the values of the first cell are displayed on the page.
[!code-cs[GridViewRowCollectionGetEnumerator#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_2_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[GridViewRowCollectionGetEnumerator#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_2_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the rows in the object can be modified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the IsReadOnly property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object can be modified.
> [!NOTE] > This property has been overridden to always return `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object can be modified in all cases.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object is synchronized (thread-safe).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the IsSynchronized property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object is thread-safe.
> [!NOTE] > This property has been overridden to always return `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object is not thread-safe.
For more information on the IsSynchronized property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.

Docs.param: The index of the object to retrieve from the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets the object at the specified index.
Docs.value: The object at the specified index in the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this indexer to retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object from the collection at the specified index, using array notation.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the indexer to retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object from the collection. The values of the cells in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRow> object are displayed on the page.
[!code-cs[GridViewRowCollectionIndexer#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_429_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[GridViewRowCollectionIndexer#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_429_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets the object used to synchronize access to the collection.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the SyncRoot property to get an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection. The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> object itself.
For more information on the SyncRoot property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(class System.Array array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The one-dimensional <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object that is the destination of the elements copied from the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface. The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in a <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object at which copying begins.
Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridViewRowCollection> instance is cast to the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
